title: The Overlooked Home Area That’s Perfect for a Quick DIY Makeover
description: Have you ever walked into your home and felt like something was missing? The answer might be right under your nose – or rather, right at your feet! Your entryway, often overlooked and underappreciated, is the perfect canvas for a quick and impactful DIY makeover. This small but mighty space sets the tone for your […] You're reading The Overlooked Home Area That’s Perfect for a Quick DIY Makeover, originally posted on Decoist. If you enjoyed this post, be sure to follow Decoist on Twitter, Facebook and Pinterest.
author: Sherry Nothingam
excerpt: Discover the often-overlooked home area perfect for a quick DIY makeover. Learn how to transform your entryway with budget-friendly ideas and simple projects for a stunning first impression.
text: Have you ever walked into your home and felt like something was missing? The answer might be right under your nose – or rather, right at your feet! Your entryway, often overlooked and underappreciated, is the perfect canvas for a quick and impactful DIY makeover. This small but mighty space sets the tone for your entire home, making it the ideal area to focus your creative energy. Let’s explore how you can transform this overlooked gem into a stunning focal point that welcomes you and your guests in style. Assess Your Space and Set Your Goals Photo Credit: Canva Pro Before embarking on your entryway makeover, evaluate the current state of your foyer. What works well, and what needs improvement? Does your space lack storage, personality, or both? Consider the size of your entryway and how it flows into the rest of your home. This assessment will help you determine your makeover goals and prioritize your DIY projects. Once you’ve identified your objectives, create a plan of action. Make a list of the changes you want to implement, from simple updates like a fresh coat of paint to more involved projects like installing custom storage solutions. Having a clear vision will help you stay focused and motivated throughout the makeover process, ensuring that your overlooked entryway becomes a standout feature of your home. Maximize Storage with Creative Solutions Photo Credit: Canva Pro One of the biggest challenges in many entryways is a lack of storage space. Fortunately, there are numerous DIY solutions to help you maximize every inch of your foyer. Consider installing floating shelves or a wall-mounted coat rack to keep essentials off the floor and within easy reach. These simple additions can instantly declutter your space and create a more organized entrance. For a more substantial storage upgrade, try building a custom bench with built-in cubbies or drawers. This multi-functional piece not only provides a place to sit while putting on shoes but also offers ample storage for seasonal items, bags, and other everyday essentials. By incorporating clever storage solutions, you’ll transform your overlooked entryway into a highly functional and welcoming space. Add Personality with Paint and Wallpaper Photo Credit: Canva Pro One of the quickest and most impactful ways to breathe new life into your entryway is through color. A fresh coat of paint can completely transform the look and feel of your foyer, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. Choose a bold hue to make a statement, or opt for a soft, neutral tone to create a calming ambiance. Don’t be afraid to experiment with accent walls or even ceiling colors to add depth and interest to your space. If you’re feeling adventurous, consider using wallpaper to create a stunning focal point in your entryway. From bold patterns to subtle textures, wallpaper can add instant personality and charm to your overlooked home area. For a budget-friendly option, try removable wallpaper, which allows you to easily update your look without committing to a permanent change. With the right color or pattern, your entryway will become a true reflection of your personal style. Illuminate Your Space with Strategic Lighting Photo Credit: Canva Pro Proper lighting is essential in creating a welcoming entryway, yet it’s often overlooked in home design. Evaluate your current lighting situation and consider ways to enhance it. Install a statement chandelier or pendant light to add drama and elegance to your foyer. For a more subtle approach, incorporate wall sconces or table lamps to create a warm and inviting glow. Don’t forget about natural light! If your entryway has windows, make the most of them by choosing window treatments that allow plenty of sunlight to filter through. Consider adding a mirror opposite the window to reflect light and create the illusion of a larger space. By focusing on both artificial and natural lighting, you’ll transform your overlooked entryway into a bright and inviting area that sets the perfect tone for your home. Incorporate Functional and Stylish Furniture Photo Credit: Canva Pro Choosing the right furniture for your entryway can make a world of difference in both style and functionality. A slim console table can provide a surface for keys, mail, and decorative items without taking up too much space. Look for pieces with drawers or shelves to maximize storage potential. If space allows, add a comfortable chair or bench to create a cozy spot for putting on shoes or dropping off bags. When selecting furniture for your entryway makeover, consider pieces that complement your home’s overall aesthetic while serving a practical purpose. A vintage trunk can double as storage and seating, while a sleek, modern coat rack can add a touch of sophistication to your space. By carefully curating your entryway furniture, you’ll create a cohesive and inviting atmosphere that seamlessly blends form and function. Accessorize and Add Personal Touches Photo Credit: Canva Pro The final step in your entryway makeover is to add those personal touches that truly make a house a home. Incorporate artwork, family photos, or a gallery wall to infuse your personality into the space. A large, statement mirror not only adds visual interest but also helps to make your entryway feel larger and brighter. Don’t forget about the power of plants – a few well-placed greenery can bring life and freshness to your foyer. Consider adding a rug or runner to define the space and add warmth underfoot. Choose a durable, easy-to-clean option that can withstand heavy foot traffic. Finally, incorporate decorative elements like a stylish umbrella stand, a unique key holder, or a beautiful tray for corralling everyday items. These small but impactful accessories will elevate your overlooked entryway from functional to fabulous. Related Articles 20 Creative Entryway Rug Ideas for a Stunning Entrance Innovative Solutions for Creating an Entryway Without One Seasonal Entryway Decor Ideas By focusing on this often-overlooked area of your home, you can create a stunning first impression that sets the tone for the rest of your living space. With a little creativity and some DIY spirit, your entryway can become a true reflection of your personal style and a welcoming oasis for both you and your guests. So roll up your sleeves, gather your supplies, and get ready to transform your overlooked entryway into the showstopping focal point it was always meant to be. Your home’s first impression will never be the same! Ready to bring new life to your home? Subscribe to our newsletter for exclusive interior design tips, trends, and ideas that will transform your space. Click here to subscribe! Sherry is a blogger who loves to live her life to the fullest. She enjoys everything associated with design, décor and stylish modern trends. Born in California, Sherry has grown up on open ranches and in a wild setting, which has defined her taste for design and developed her interest in examining how structures and homes interact with the beauti[...]
html:
Have you ever walked into your home and felt like something was missing? The answer might be right under your nose – or rather, right at your feet! Your entryway, often overlooked and underappreciated, is the perfect canvas for a quick and impactful DIY makeover. This small but mighty space sets the tone for your entire home, making it the ideal area to focus your creative energy. Let’s explore how you can transform this overlooked gem into a stunning focal point that welcomes you and your guests in style.

Assess Your Space and Set Your Goals

Before embarking on your entryway makeover, evaluate the current state of your foyer. What works well, and what needs improvement? Does your space lack storage, personality, or both? Consider the size of your entryway and how it flows into the rest of your home. This assessment will help you determine your makeover goals and prioritize your DIY projects.

Once you’ve identified your objectives, create a plan of action. Make a list of the changes you want to implement, from simple updates like a fresh coat of paint to more involved projects like installing custom storage solutions. Having a clear vision will help you stay focused and motivated throughout the makeover process, ensuring that your overlooked entryway becomes a standout feature of your home.

Maximize Storage with Creative Solutions

One of the biggest challenges in many entryways is a lack of storage space. Fortunately, there are numerous DIY solutions to help you maximize every inch of your foyer. Consider installing floating shelves or a wall-mounted coat rack to keep essentials off the floor and within easy reach. These simple additions can instantly declutter your space and create a more organized entrance.

For a more substantial storage upgrade, try building a custom bench with built-in cubbies or drawers. This multi-functional piece not only provides a place to sit while putting on shoes but also offers ample storage for seasonal items, bags, and other everyday essentials. By incorporating clever storage solutions, you’ll transform your overlooked entryway into a highly functional and welcoming space.

Add Personality with Paint and Wallpaper

One of the quickest and most impactful ways to breathe new life into your entryway is through color. A fresh coat of paint can completely transform the look and feel of your foyer, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. Choose a bold hue to make a statement, or opt for a soft, neutral tone to create a calming ambiance. Don’t be afraid to experiment with accent walls or even ceiling colors to add depth and interest to your space.

If you’re feeling adventurous, consider using wallpaper to create a stunning focal point in your entryway. From bold patterns to subtle textures, wallpaper can add instant personality and charm to your overlooked home area. For a budget-friendly option, try removable wallpaper, which allows you to easily update your look without committing to a permanent change. With the right color or pattern, your entryway will become a true reflection of your personal style.

Illuminate Your Space with Strategic Lighting

Proper lighting is essential in creating a welcoming entryway, yet it’s often overlooked in home design. Evaluate your current lighting situation and consider ways to enhance it. Install a statement chandelier or pendant light to add drama and elegance to your foyer. For a more subtle approach, incorporate wall sconces or table lamps to create a warm and inviting glow.

Don’t forget about natural light! If your entryway has windows, make the most of them by choosing window treatments that allow plenty of sunlight to filter through. Consider adding a mirror opposite the window to reflect light and create the illusion of a larger space. By focusing on both artificial and natural lighting, you’ll transform your overlooked entryway into a bright and inviting area that sets the perfect tone for your home.

Incorporate Functional and Stylish Furniture

Choosing the right furniture for your entryway can make a world of difference in both style and functionality. A slim console table can provide a surface for keys, mail, and decorative items without taking up too much space. Look for pieces with drawers or shelves to maximize storage potential. If space allows, add a comfortable chair or bench to create a cozy spot for putting on shoes or dropping off bags.

When selecting furniture for your entryway makeover, consider pieces that complement your home’s overall aesthetic while serving a practical purpose. A vintage trunk can double as storage and seating, while a sleek, modern coat rack can add a touch of sophistication to your space. By carefully curating your entryway furniture, you’ll create a cohesive and inviting atmosphere that seamlessly blends form and function.

Accessorize and Add Personal Touches

The final step in your entryway makeover is to add those personal touches that truly make a house a home. Incorporate artwork, family photos, or a gallery wall to infuse your personality into the space. A large, statement mirror not only adds visual interest but also helps to make your entryway feel larger and brighter. Don’t forget about the power of plants – a few well-placed greenery can bring life and freshness to your foyer.

Consider adding a rug or runner to define the space and add warmth underfoot. Choose a durable, easy-to-clean option that can withstand heavy foot traffic. Finally, incorporate decorative elements like a stylish umbrella stand, a unique key holder, or a beautiful tray for corralling everyday items. These small but impactful accessories will elevate your overlooked entryway from functional to fabulous.

Related Articles

  • 20 Creative Entryway Rug Ideas for a Stunning Entrance
  • Innovative Solutions for Creating an Entryway Without One
  • Seasonal Entryway Decor Ideas

By focusing on this often-overlooked area of your home, you can create a stunning first impression that sets the tone for the rest of your living space. With a little creativity and some DIY spirit, your entryway can become a true reflection of your personal style and a welcoming oasis for both you and your guests. So roll up your sleeves, gather your supplies, and get ready to transform your overlooked entryway into the showstopping focal point it was always meant to be. Your home’s first impression will never be the same!

Ready to bring new life to your home? Subscribe to our newsletter for exclusive interior design tips, trends, and ideas that will transform your space. Click here to subscribe!

Sherry is a blogger who loves to live her life to the fullest. She enjoys everything associated with design, décor and stylish modern trends.
